name: Play the Game! Quiz | Sports for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text:
In this sport I might be doing the breaststroke, butterfly or backstroke. 
Which sport is it?
questions.explanation:
Swimming.

	If you cannot swim, get someone you know to teach you. It is good exercise. It will help to keep you fit - and it is great fun too!

questions.text:
For my next sport I use a long pole with a paddle on the end of it. 
I have two of these. One in each hand. They are called oars. What am I doing now?
questions.explanation:
Rowing.

	It is hard to row in a straight line at first. But you soon get the hang of it. If you go on the water in a boat or dinghy ALWAYS REMEMBER TO WEAR A LIFE JACKET!

questions.text:
What can I do next to use up some more of my energy? 
I know! I need some boots with small wheels on the bottom of them. 
What am I up to this time?
questions.explanation:
Roller-skating.

	Roller-skating is difficult at first. But you soon get the knack. You might fall over, so ALWAYS wear the right protective clothing.

questions.text:
For my next sport I need a racket, some balls and a net. 
What am I playing?
questions.explanation:
Tennis.

	Tennis is played on a tennis court, against an opponent. They hold big tournaments all over the world to find out who is the best player.

questions.text:
I am on the move again. 
This time I have wheels, two pedals and handlebars. 
What am I doing now?
questions.explanation:
Cycling.

	It takes a while to get your balance on a bicycle so ALWAYS wear a helmet.

questions.text:
For my next sport I need some stumps, a hard ball and a bat. 
What game am I playing this time?
questions.explanation:
Cricket.

	Cricket is a summer game. It is played between two teams on a large field. It can take five days to complete a match. Cricket was first played more than 400 years ago.

questions.text:
I have moved on to the athletics arena - phew this is tiring! 
I am about to throw a type of spear as far as I can. 
I had better be careful with this one! 
What is the sport I am doing called?
questions.explanation:
The Javelin.

	A top athlete can throw a javelin nearly 100 yards [almost 95 metres]. Watch out!

questions.text:
For this sport I need to wear gloves and shorts.
It takes place in a thing called a ring - but it is square!
What am I doing now?
questions.explanation:
Boxing.

	In boxing two men punch one another and try to knock their opponent down. Ouch! I do not like this. Let us move on.

questions.text:
I am now in a gymnasium bouncing myself high into the air.
Look! I can do somersaults. 
This is fun. What am I jumping on?
questions.explanation:
A Trampoline.

	With some practice on the trampoline you can learn to perform lots of acrobatic jumps.

questions.text:
This is my last sport today. Good; I am really tired now. 
Well, I have my feet in stirrups and reins in my hands.
This is more relaxing! What am I doing?
questions.explanation:
Horse Riding.

	Horses are wonderful creatures. It is fairly easy to ride a well trained horse. But remember if you get on a horse ALWAYS wear a safety helmet. Good luck! I am off for a well earned rest. It has been a busy day.
